sen.j: 薩長同盟 （さっちょうどうめい）は、江戸時代後期の慶応2年1月21日 (旧暦)（1866年3月7日）に幕末の薩摩藩と長州藩の間で締結された政治的、軍事的同盟である。
sen.e: "Saccho Domei" refers to the political and military alliance concluded on March 7, 1866 in the last days of the Edo period between the Satsuma clan and Choshu clan.
Saccho Domei' refers to the political and military alliance concluded on March 7, 1866 in the last days of the Edo period between the Satsuma Domain and Choshu Domain.
Saccho Domei' refers to the political and military alliance concluded on March 7, 1866 in the last days of the Edo period between the Satsuma Domain and Choshu Domain.

sen.j: 薩長盟約、薩長連合ともいう。
sen.e: It is also called "Saccho Meiyaku" (Satsuma-Choshu Confederacy), or "Saccho Rengo" (Satsuma-Choshu League).
It is also called the "Saccho Meiyaku" (Satsuma-Choshu Confederacy) or "Saccho Rengo" (Satsuma-Choshu League).
It is also called the "Saccho Meiyaku" (Satsuma-Choshu Confederacy) or "Saccho Rengo" (Satsuma-Choshu League).

sen.j: 幕末の政治世界で影響力を持った薩摩藩と長州藩は討幕の思想では共通していた。
sen.e: The Satsuma clan and the Choshu clan, both of which had clout in the Japanese political circles in the last days of the Edo period, had the anti-shogunate idea in common.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Satsuma and Choshu Domains, both of which had clout within Japanese political circles in the last days of the Edo period, had the anti-shogunate idea in common.

sen.j: しかし西郷隆盛・大久保利通らの薩摩は、1864年（元治元年）の会津藩と協力した八月十八日の政変や禁門の変で長州を京都から追放した。
sen.e: However, the Satsuma clan, led by Takamori SAIGO and Toshimichi OKUBO, ousted the Choshu clan out of Kyoto through Coup on August 18 and "Kinmon no Hen" (the Kinmon Incident) in cooperation with the Aizu clan.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, the Satsuma Domain, led by Takamori SAIGO and Toshimichi OKUBO, ousted the Choshu Domain from Kyoto in the Coup of August 18 and the "Kinmon no Hen" (the Kinmon Incident) in cooperation with the Aizu Domain.

However, the Satsuma Domain, led by Takamori SAIGO and Toshimichi OKUBO, ousted the Choshu Domain from Kyoto in the Coup of August 18 and the "Kinmon no Hen" (the Kinmon Incident) in cooperation with the Aizu Domain.

sen.j: さらに第一次長州征伐（幕長戦争)でも薩摩が長州を屈服させた。
sen.e: In addition, in the First Choshu Expedition (also called "Baku-cho" war [the war between Choshu and 'Bakufu,' or the shogunate]), the Satsuma clan took part in the expedition and forced the Choshu clan to surrender.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: それゆえ両者は感情的には敵対していた。
sen.e: Therefore, the two clans had hostility to each other.

sen.j: にもかかわらず、長州、薩摩共に伝のある土佐藩脱藩の坂本龍馬や中岡慎太郎の斡旋により、主戦派の長州藩重臣である福永喜助宅において会談が進められた。
sen.e: Notwithstanding, the two clans held a conference at the residence of the Choshu clan's senior retainer Kisuke FUKUNAGA (an advocate of the war against Bakufu), with the mediation of Ryoma SAKAMOTO and Shintaro NAKAOKA, both of whom had left the Tosa clan and had relationship with the Satsuma and Choshu clan.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文の例外対処 ・「主戦派」とは「開戦派」という意味であり、ここではより具体的には「対幕府開戦派」をさすものと解しています。

sen.j: 下関での会談を西郷が直前に拒否する事態もあったが、1月21日（22日説も）京都小松清廉邸（京都市上京区）で坂本を介して西郷隆盛、大久保利通、薩摩藩家老の小松清廉と長州藩の木戸孝允（当時は桂小五郎）が倒幕運動に協力する6か条の同盟を締結した。
sen.e: Although the conference due to be held in Shimonoseki was cancelled by Saigo just before its start, the six-article alliance for defeating the shogunate was concluded on March 7 (some say on March 8) with the mediation of Sakamoto at Kiyotada KOMATSU's residence in Kyoto (in the present Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City) between the Satsuma representatives (Takamori SAIGO, Toshimichi OKUBO and Kiyotada KOMOTSU [the clan's chief retainer]) and the Choshu counterpart Takayoshi KIDO (called Kogoro KATSURA at that time).

sen.j: 他の薩摩側出席者は、島津伊勢（諏訪甚六広兼）、桂久武、吉井友実、奈良原繁。
sen.e: Besides, there were some attendees from the Satsuma clan, that is, Ise SHIMAZU (also called Jinroku Koken SUWA), Hisatake KATSURA, Tomozane YOSHII and Shigeru NARAHARA.

Contents of the alliance made up of six articles
sen.cmt: *下記現代語訳はいずれも次のHP（の後半部分にある「薩長同盟」の項目）を参照しています。[http://f40.aaa.livedoor.jp~paulnobu/sattyodomei-teiketsu.html]
sen.e: Content of the Alliance (Six Articles)
Content of the Alliance (Six Articles)

sen.j: 一、戦いと相成候時は、すぐさま二千余の兵を急速差登し只今在京の兵と合し、浪華へも一千程は差置き、京阪両所相固め候事
sen.e: Article 1: When the war breaks out between the Choshu clan and Bakufu, the Satsuma clan shall immediately dispatch its 2000-odd soldiers to kyoto, make them guard Kyoto together with the soldiers already there at present, and keep about 1000 soldiers in Osaka, thereby taking control of Kyoto and Osaka.
sen.cmt: 現代語訳・・・「（幕府と長州の）戦いになったら薩摩はすみやかに2000余名の兵を上京させ在京の兵と合流させて、更に大坂にも約1000名の兵を配して、京都大坂を固めること。」
sen.e: Article 1: When war breaks out between the Choshu clan and bakufu, the Satsuma Domain shall immediately dispatch its approximately 2000 soldiers to Kyoto, make them guard Kyoto together with the soldiers already there at present, and keep about 1000 soldiers in Osaka, thereby taking control of Kyoto and Osaka.
sen.cmt: Rewritten for fluency, consistency and capitalisation
sen.e: Article 1: When war breaks out between the Choshu clan and bakufu, the Satsuma Domain shall immediately dispatch its approximately 2000 soldiers to Kyoto, make them guard Kyoto together with the soldiers already there at present, and keep about 1000 soldiers in Osaka, thereby taking control of Kyoto and Osaka.

sen.j: 一、戦、自然も我が勝利と相成り候気鋒相見え候とき、其節朝廷へ申上げきっと尽力の次第これあり候との事
sen.e: Article 2 : When the Choshu's victory comes near at hand, the Satsuma clan shall immediately appeal to the court to back up Choshu and make every effort to mediate a peace.
sen.cmt: 現代語訳・・・「長州が戦いに勝てそうなときは、ただちに薩摩は朝廷に働きかけて長州を支援し、講和成立に尽力すること。」
sen.e: Article 2 : When the Choshu Domain's victory is near at hand, the Satsuma Domain shall immediately appeal to the Imperial Court to back up Choshu and make every effort to mediate a peace.
Article 2 : When the Choshu Domain's victory is near at hand, the Satsuma Domain shall immediately appeal to the Imperial Court to back up Choshu and make every effort to mediate a peace.

sen.j: 一、万一敗色に相成り候とも、一年や半年に決して潰滅致し候と申す事はこれなき事に付き其間には必ず尽力の次第これあり候との事
sen.e: Article 3 : Even if worst comes to worst, the total destruction of the Choshu clan would not come in a year, or at least half a year, so the Satsuma clan shall make every effort to help Choshu during the period.
sen.cmt: 現代語訳・・・「万一長州が戦いに負けそうな時でも、一年や半年では壊滅することはないから、その間薩摩は長州の援護に尽力すること。」
sen.e: Article 3 : Even if worst comes to worst, the total destruction of the Choshu Domain would not come in a year, or at least half a year, so the Satsuma Domain shall make every effort to help Choshu during this period.

Article 3 : Even if worst comes to worst, the total destruction of the Choshu Domain would not come in a year, or at least half a year, so the Satsuma Domain shall make every effort to help Choshu during this period.

sen.j: 一、是なりにて幕兵東帰せし時は、きっと朝廷へ申上げすぐさま冤罪は朝廷より御免に相成り候都合にきっと尽力との事
sen.e: Article 4 : When the war ends in stalemate and Bakufu returns to Kanto region, the Satsuma clan shall definitely appeal to the court for clearing up the false charge of being the enemy of the emperor, which was imposed on Choshu on the occasion of Coup on August 18.
sen.cmt: 現代語訳・・・「勝負がつかず幕府が関東に引き上げた時は、薩摩は必ず朝廷にかけあって長州の冤罪（八月十八日の政変で朝敵とされたこと。訳者注）がすぐに晴れるよう尽力すること。」
sen.e: Article 4 : When the war ends in stalemate and bakufu returns to the Kanto region, the Satsuma Domain shall definitely appeal to the Imperial Court to clear up the false charge of being the enemy of the emperor, which was imposed on Choshu on the occasion of Coup on August 18.

Article 4 : When the war ends in stalemate and bakufu returns to the Kanto region, the Satsuma Domain shall definitely appeal to the Imperial Court to clear up the false charge of being the enemy of the emperor, which was imposed on Choshu on the occasion of Coup on August 18.

sen.j: 一、兵士をも上国の土、橋、会、桑も只今の如き次第にて、勿体なくも朝廷を擁し奉り、正義を抗し、周旋尽力の道を相遮り候時は、終に決戦に及ぶほかこれなくとの事
sen.e: Article 5 : We will make our forces come into Kyoto and Osaka, so if the clan of Hitotsubashi, Kuwana and Aizu (the allies of Bakufu) continue to commit the sacrilege of utilizing the court, reject the implementation of the right, and block the mediation of the Satsuma clan, we cannot help but fight a decisive battle against Bakufu.
sen.cmt: 現代語訳・・・「（京都・大坂に）兵士を上らせる以上、（幕府方の）一橋・桑名・会津の各藩が、恐れ多くも朝廷を利用して正義を拒み、薩摩の周旋を妨げることを続けるならば、幕府とやむを得ず決戦に及ぶほかはない。」（ここと次のセルについては下記HPも参照しました。なお、原文一行目の「土」は「上」の誤りですので英訳では訂正しています。) [http://inforyoma.com/monogatari/jobun.htm]
sen.e: Article 5 : We will make our forces come into Kyoto and Osaka, so if the clan of Hitotsubashi, Kuwana and Aizu (the allies of Bakufu) continue to commit the sacrilege of utilizing the Imperial Court, reject the implementation of the right, and block the mediation of the Satsuma Domain, we cannot help but fight a decisive battle against bakufu.

Article 5 : We will make our forces come into Kyoto and Osaka, so if the clan of Hitotsubashi, Kuwana and Aizu (the allies of Bakufu) continue to commit the sacrilege of utilizing the Imperial Court, reject the implementation of the right, and block the mediation of the Satsuma Domain, we cannot help but fight a decisive battle against bakufu.

sen.j: 一、冤罪も御免の上は、双方とも誠心を以て相合し、皇国の御為に砕身尽力仕り候事は申すに及ばず、いづれの道にしても、今日より双方皇国の御為め皇威相輝き、御回復に立ち至り候を目途に誠しを尽くして尽力して致すべくとの事なり
sen.e: Article 6 : When the false charge is cleared up, both of the Satsuma clan and Choshu clan are sure to be reconciled sincerely with each other and to do their best for the sake of the Japanese Empire, and regardless of the result of the Satsuma clan's appeal about the charge, both clans shall make every effort from today with sincerity to revive and extend the imperial authority for the empire's sake.
sen.cmt: 現代語訳・・・「長州藩の冤罪が晴れたなら薩摩藩と長州藩は心からの和解をなし皇国のために砕身尽力するのは勿論だが、その件の結果如何にかかわりなく、今日から両藩は皇国のために皇威が輝き回復するよう誠心誠意尽力すること。」（長文ですが、歴史的文書ゆえ分割は控えました。）
sen.e: Article 6 : When the false charge is cleared up, both the Satsuma Domain and Choshu Domain are sure to be reconciled sincerely with each other and to do their best for the sake of the Japanese Empire, and regardless of the result of the Satsuma Domain's appeal about the charge, both clans shall make every effort from today with sincerity to revive and extend the imperial authority for the empire's sake.

Article 6 : When the false charge is cleared up, both the Satsuma Domain and Choshu Domain are sure to be reconciled sincerely with each other and to do their best for the sake of the Japanese Empire, and regardless of the result of the Satsuma Domain's appeal about the charge, both clans shall make every effort from today with sincerity to revive and extend the imperial authority for the empire's sake.

sen.j: 坂本龍馬が桂小五郎の求めに応じて裏面に朱書で、裏書署名している。
sen.e: At the request of Kogoro KATSURA, Ryoma SAKAMOTO endorsed the document of the alliance with the brush dipped in vermillion ink.

sen.j: 表に御記入しなされ候六条は小・西両氏および老兄龍等も御同席にて談論せし所にて、毛も相違これなく候。
sen.e: The six articles written on the face were concluded in the presence of some people, such as Kiyotada KOMATSU, Takamari SAIGO, Kogoro KATSURA, and Ryoma SAKAMOTO, and the contents are just the same as the alliance.
sen.cmt: 現代語訳・・・「表に記入された六条は小松、西郷両氏、及び桂、龍馬らも同席して論決したもので、実際の同盟といささかも相違がない。」

sen.j: 従来といえども決して変わり候事はこれなきは神明の知る所に御座候。
sen.e: God knows the alliance will never change in the future, too.
